name: militaristically
content:
Add to word list

in a way that supports or relates to the idea of having powerful armed forces in a country: They tried to show that they had the advantage, politically, militaristically, and economically. By the year 1250, the region was occupied by 15–20 militaristically competitive city-states.
More examplesFewer examplesHe felt that a small army of well-paid mercenaries was militaristically superior to a large domestic army.We often describe the body’s immune system militaristically, speaking of immune defenses and of invaders and battles.
